intro: Heterostemma samoense, commonly known as the Samoan star vine, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Samoa and nearby regions in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many tropical shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Heterostemma samoense is often found growing in coastal and lowland areas, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates.
